emuInput.TitMainTitle: Rev. J. A. Williams touching cornerstone of Baptist Temple Church with group of girls and boys, Frankstown Avenue at Collier Street, Homewood
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 27, 1946, pg. 2, reads: "Masons Lay Cornerstone - Pittsburgh Free and Accepted Scottish Rite Masons took part in laying the cornerstone of the newly purchased Baptist Temple Church, corner of Race and Sterrett Streets, here Sunday afternoon.  Rev. James A. Williams, pastor of the church, presided, with the cornerstone dedication sermon, 'The Chief Cornerstone' being preached by Rev. J. W. Barnes of West End.  Atty. Joseph W. Givens, head of local Masons, took charge of the elaborate cornerstone laying ceremony by the Masonic lodge. - Harris photo."
